licence_overview:
If you photocopy hymns or worship songs (music or words) for assemblies or other collective worship activities at your school, you need a licence from [Christian Copyright Licensing International (CCLI).](http://www.ccli.co.uk/ "Christian Copyright Licensing International"){:rel="external"}

This licence can only be obtained in addition to a [collective worship copyright licence.](/collective-worship-copyright-licence "Collective Worship Copyright licence")

##How to apply

You can apply for a licence online on the [CCLI website.](http://www.ccli.co.uk/licences/ "How to apply"){:rel="external"}

You must pay a licence fee based on the number of pupils at your school.

You must renew your licence annually.

##Conditions

Licences are subject to certain conditions, such as:

* ensuring that all photocopied songs are inscribed with your licence number
* supplying CCLI with a copy of any photocopied song on request
* using CCLI's CopyReport software to report all the songs that have been photocopied under your licence

##Fines and penalties

%If you photocopy hymns or songs without a licence, you are infringing copyright and could be sued for damages.%

If you fail to pay the licence fee or comply with any other licence conditions, CCLI may terminate the licence. If that happens, you must stop using any photocopied songs and arrange for them to be destroyed.

If you want to photocopy from non-music publications (eg drama scripts or text books) you must contact the [Copyright Licensing Authority](http://www.cla.co.uk/ "Copyright Licensing Authority"){:rel="external"} instead.

*[CCLI]: Christian Copyright Licensing International
